discussion.content: 9 months equals to 1125 GB according to my calculations

i think the correct answer is B
9 months gives you 1.7 TB

comments.content:
9 months*50GB + 15GB (backup monthly increase)*45(number of times 15GB has been added from month 1) = 450+675 = 1125 GB which exceeds 1024GB=1TB
there must be a formula for this arithmetic progression

questions.question_text:
A technician performs monthly backups on a file server to a NAS device that can hold 1TB of data. The size of the monthly backups has been as follows:

Month 1 = 50GB -

Month 2 = 65GB -

Month 3 = 80GB -
Starting with Month 1, based on the current rate of growth, in how many months will the NAS run out of available storage space?

discussion.content:
Port 22
SFTP/ SSH / SCP port 22 is correct
Remote administration is done with RDP which is 3389. The answer TCP 3389 is the correct answer
This answer is wrong. The correct answer was shown when this same question was previously asked and response was correct. B is the right answer.

questions.question_text:
A server technician needs to access a remote Unix server for administration. The technician has requested that ports 23, 25, and 161 be opened on the router.
After the ports are opened, the technician is still unable to connect to the Unix server. Which of the following ports should be opened on the server to allow for remote administration?

A new version of the primary OS used by a company has been released. Due to some significant changes in the OS, a system administrator wants to see which remotely accessible services are enabled by default to access the security risk prior to upgrading to the new version. Which of the following utilities should the administrator use?

discussion.content: repeated question please remove was in the previous ones before

questions.question_text: Which of the following represents the directory permissions to provide least privilege for publicly readable directories on a Unix web server?

discussion.content: this question in not part of the exam, they do not teach us this.

Bridged is an incorrect answer. It should be NAT. These are the options taken directly from network settings for a VM.

Bridged: Connected directly to the physical network
NAT: Used to share the host's IP address
Host-only: A private network shared with the host
Custom: Specific virtual network

questions.question_text: Which of the following virtual network settings should be used if the IP addresses of the host is to be shared with the virtual machine?
